Content: @Mylo Hi Mylo! When I reboot nothing is started automatically yet. I haven't setup it that way yet. I need to type these again:

Author: Strob#3417
Content:
./start
CTRL-C
cd komodo/src
./assetchains
# and wait 15 minutes before you go to the next step
cd ~/SuperNET/iguana
git checkout dev && git pull && ./m_notary &
# wait until you see `INIT with 64 notaries`
./dpowassets

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: what is your scripting like?

Author: Strob#3417
Content: What do you mean?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
when you start iguana, modify `m_notary_run` so it logs to a file

this is near the top of `m_notary_run`
```
iguana_arg=${2:-notary}
stdbuf -oL $1 ../agents/iguana $iguana_arg  & #> iguana.log 2> error.log  &
```
make it look like this
```
iguana_arg=${2:-notary}
stdbuf -oL $1 ../agents/iguana $iguana_arg  > iguana.log 2> error.log  &
```

when you have an iguana.log file, it's easier to work with.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: just remove `& #` before the `>`.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: you'll then end up with a log file at `~/SuperNET/iguana/iguana.log` you can read

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
use `crontab -e` and put
```
@reboot /home/me/bin/start_kmd.sh
```
and then make a file `/home/me/bin/start_kmd.sh` with
```
#!/bin/bash
komodod &
```
to start off with.

Also make sure komodod is in your path
```
ln -sf /home/me/komodo/src/komodod /usr/local/bin/
```
to make a sym-link.

Then reboot, see if komodo comes back up.  (iguana won't we haven't made a script for it)

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: if it works, tell the next person.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: `chmod +x /home/me/bin/start_kmd.sh` to make it executable...sorry i forgot
